result.markdown:
---
title: "Operadores, listas y vectores"
format: html
---



# Tipos de datos básicos

- Numéricos
- Enteros
- Texto
- Booleanos

# Operadores ariméticos

## Suma



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
2 + 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 4
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a <- 10
b <- 20
a + b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 30
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a + 100
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 110
```


:::
:::



## Resta



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a - 200
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] -190
```


:::
:::




## Multiplicación



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a * b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 200
```


:::
:::




## División



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a / b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.5
```


:::
:::




## Potencia



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
2 ^ 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 4
```


:::
:::




# Operadores de comparación

## Mayor que



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a > b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] FALSE
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a > 5
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::




## Menor que



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a < 10
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] FALSE
```


:::
:::




## Mayor o igual que



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a >= 10
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::




## Menor o igual que



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a <= 10
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::




## Igualdad



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a == b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] FALSE
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a == a
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::




## Diferencia (no igual)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a != b 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
2 != 3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::




# Listas (`list()`)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lista1 <- list(1, 2, 3)
lista1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[[1]]
[1] 1

[[2]]
[1] 2

[[3]]
[1] 3
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lista2 <- list("a", 20, TRUE)
lista2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[[1]]
[1] "a"

[[2]]
[1] 20

[[3]]
[1] TRUE
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
class(lista2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "list"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
length(lista2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 3
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Error: no es posible sumar a los elementos de la lista el número 3
lista1 + 3
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# En R sí es posible comparar los elementos de la lista con algún número o elemento de interés
lista1 > 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE
```


:::
:::





# Vectoes (array 1D)



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
vector1 <- c(1, 2, 3)
vector1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 1 2 3
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
class(vector1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "numeric"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
length(vector1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 3
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# En los vectores sí es posible realizar operaciones aritméticas elemento a elemento
vector1 + 10
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 11 12 13
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# En los vectores también es posible comparar los elementos 
vector1 > 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# En los vectores (arrays) no es posible mezclar los tipos de datos
vector2 = c(1, 2, 3, "a")
vector2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "1" "2" "3" "a"
```


:::
:::



# Indexación (subconjuntos)

- La indexación en R comienza desde el número 1.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
vector2[1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "1"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
vector2[-4]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "1" "2" "3"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# 1: incluyente
# 2: incluyente
vector2[1:2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "1" "2"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Error: no es posible en R usar los dos puntos para recuperar más de un elemento
vector2[1:]
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Error: no es posible en R usar los dos puntos para recuperar más de un elemento
vector2[:1]
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Obtenemos NA (no disponible) porque no hay nada en la posición 5 del vector
vector2[5]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] NA
```


:::
:::
